title: What is the shortest #1 hit single record? - Quora

response.answer_text: In the UK, Adam Faith’s 1959 chart topper What Do You Want (1’38). In the US, Maurice Williams & The Zodiacs’ Stay (1’37), which was also released in 1959. In Australia, if you’re interested, there’s Johnny O’Keefe’s Own True Self (1’44, also 1959). There were lots of short, concise Number Ones in the 50s and 60s — The Beatles’ From Me To You (a UK No.1 in 1963) gets the job done in 1’56, The Letter by The Box Tops (a US No.1 in 1967) clocks in at 1’53, while Elvis Presley’s Teddy Bear (a US No.1 in 1957) says everything it needs to say in 1’46.

The original recording of "Stay" remains the shortest single ever to reach the top of the American record charts, at 1 minute 36 seconds in length. By 1990, it had sold more than 8 million copies. It received a new lease of popularity after being featured on the Dirty Dancing soundtrack.
